Key Match Events: Shivam Dube hit an unbeaten 60 as India defeated Afghanistan by six wickets.
Rohit Sharma was run out due to a mix-up with Shubman Gill.
Axar Patel and Mukesh Kumar bagged two wickets each to help India restrict Afghanistan to 158/5.
Mohammad Nabi hit a quickfire 42 for Afghanistan.
Azmatullah Omarzai played a rapid cameo of 29.
Mukesh Kumar dismissed both Mohammad Nabi and Azmatullah Omarzai in the same over.
Jitesh Sharma scored a useful 31 in 20 balls.
Tilak Varma scored 26 before being caught by Gulbadin Naib.
Shubman Gill scored 23 before being stumped by Rahmanullah Gurbaz.
Rinku Singh played a late and fine shot to deep third.
India chased down the target with 15 balls to spare.
Pre-Game Insights: India opted to bowl first after winning the toss.
Rohit Sharma returned to T20I format after a gap of 14 months.
Yashasvi Jaiswal was unavailable for selection due to a sore right groin.
India's playing XI included Rohit Sharma, Shubman Gill, Tilak Varma, Shivam Dube, Jitesh Sharma, Rinku Singh, Axar Patel, Washington Sundar, Ravi Bishnoi, Arshdeep Singh, and Mukesh Kumar.

Afghanistan's playing XI included Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Ibrahim Zadran, Rahmat Shah, Azmatullah Omarzai, Mohammad Nabi, Najibullah Zadran, Karim Janat, Gulbadin Naib, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Naveen-ul-Haq, and Mujeeb Ur Rahman.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Punjab Cricket Association IS Bindra Stadium, Mohali.
India took a 1-0 lead in the series.
The second game is scheduled to be played on Sunday in Indore.
